article.headline: Loyola Marymount 81, N. Arizona 61
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Jarred DuBois scored 17 points to lead six players in double figures for Loyola Marymount in an 81-61 victory against Northern Arizona on Saturday night. LaRon Armstead added 11 points, and four players -- Quincy Lawson, Godwin Okonji, Ayodeji Egbeyemi and C.J. Blackwell -- had 10 each for the Lions (3-2). James Douglas had 16 points and Colin Gruber 15 for the Lumberjacks (2-4). DuBois and Okonji had four points each during a 12-0 run by Loyola Marymount over a 3:21 stretch of the first half. The surge gave the Lions a 38-28 lead, a cushion they built to 22 points in the second half.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
